snippet: Merrill Newman did top-secret work as an Army intelligence officer during the Korean War. On a return visit to the North this fall, he was accused of war crimes and held, then released.
abstract: Merrill Newman, who did top-secret work as Army intelligence officer during Korean War, is released by North Korea after being accused of war crimes and held; state-run news agency released video of Newman reading stilted 'apology' in last act of contrition that appears to have led to his release and flight out of country.

byline.original: By BARRY BEARAK and CHOE SANG-HUN
byline.contributor: Barry Bearak reported from New York, and Choe Sang-hun from Seoul, South Korea. Erica Goode contributed reporting from Palo Alto, Calif., and Michael D. Shear from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Merrill Newman did top-secret work as an Army intelligence officer during the Korean War. On a return visit to the North this fall, he was accused of war crimes and held, then released.

headline.main: North Korea Says It Has Released Veteran It Held After Visit
headline.print_headline: Veteran Freed by North Korea After Finding War Is Still On
